greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is n divided by the largest power of the squarefree kernel of n (A007947) which divides it.
comment: a(n) divides A003557 but is not equal to it.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: n=1800: the squarefree kernel is 2*3*5 = 30 and 900 = 30^2 divides n, a(1800) = 2, the quotient of 1800/900.
mathematica: {1}~Join~Table[n/#^IntegerExponent[n, #] &@ Last@ Select[Divisors@ n, SquareFreeQ], {n, 2, 104}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Nov 02 2017 *)
program: A051904(n) = if(1==n,0,vecmin(factor(n)[, 2])); \\ After _Charles R Greathouse IV_'s code
xref: Cf. A059404 (n such that a(n)>1), A072774 (n such that a(n)=1).
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Jul 16 2001
